N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 2651.7 - Limitations of grants

State Regulations
(a) State aid
will be granted as follows: (1)

The cost of
operation of the housing code enforcement program by the housing and
development administration, provided that the program and personnel shall be
under the immediate direction of the housing code enforcement program official
who is directly responsible to the administrator of housing and development. A
vacancy in the position of the housing code enforcement program official shall
be filled promptly, preferably within six months. (2)

The cost of supplies and equipment used
in the housing code enforcement program. (3)

The cost of investigation, inspection and
advisory services which are a part of the housing and enforcement
program. (4)

Other housing control
programs of activities of the housing and development administration, including
research and training of housing code inspection personnel, submitted to the
commissioner for consideration and receiving favorable action by him. (5)

Contributions for employee health
insurance and retirement funds including social security. (6)

The maintenance, repair and operation of
multiple dwellings pursuant to section
309
of
the Multiple Dwelling Law. (b) Projects or services excluded from State
aid reimbursement are: (1)

Activities for
which State aid is otherwise specifically provided by any State law. (2)

The construction or demolition of
housing. (3)

Activities in
connection with the placement, moving or relocation of occupants of
housing. (4)

All rentals for space
utilized for housing and development administration purposes, if such rentals
are payable to the City of New York. (5)

The cost of plan review, investigations, inspections and advisory services dealing with new construction performed by
the department of buildings or by separate contract. (6)

Where a project or service approved by
the commissioner receives Federal aid. The portion so financed will be excluded
from reimbursement. Notes
